data.title: Retelling Vyborg
data.meta_description: Future Architecture is the first pan-European platform of architecture museums, festivals and producers embracing a wide range of emerging talents.
data.text:
Search

Ideas Journal Events News Video

Idea by

Mascha Kremer, Yue Mao

Maria Kremer

Novoalekseevskaya ulitsa 5a, 32, Moscow, Russia

Mascha is an architect and artist based in Moscow, who holds a Master of Architecture from TU Munich. After obtaining her Master in Urbanism from TU Delft, Yue is exploring in between urbanism, art and curating. The duo met upon project ‘What Do Landscapes Say’. This project, supported by Creative Industries Fund NL, investigates the diversity of landscapes and identities in Russia by a multidisciplinary Dutch-Russian art collective. ‘Retelling Vyborg’ is a sub-project under this framework.

Call for ideas 2020

Retelling Vyborg

An Expedition in Time to the Russian-Finnish Border

Retelling Vyborg

An Expedition in Time to the Russian-Finnish Border

Site-specific interventions to exchange narratives between researchers and citizens in Vyborg

File under

# Social

Type of project

Site-specific cases

Historically, Vyborg is an indispensable part of Finnish culture, reflected by its urban fabrics and architecture. But in 1944, it changed hands to Russia. As outside researchers, we share our investigation of Vyborg; meanwhile, we invite locals to tell their memories and imaginaries.

We find relations between social activities from different times and recreate them in a one day festival, with 4 installations + performative acts in the city. Histories are approached from macro perspective, such as political beliefs, to human perspective, such as workers life and mythologies.

By creating alternative narratives of the past via collective memories, we open up contextualized approaches towards future architecture. The participatory process experiments how controversial histories can be critically and constructively discussed through spatial and performative interventions.

‘Retelling Vyborg’ is under co-development with the locals, the site-specific actions will happen in April 2020.
